page.title: 10FISHING
page.content: {Very few fishermen}go to the{Westside to catch lobsters or crabs because it is a{very rocky place}with frequent strong winds.During the{May to {September}period only{one boat}fishes there for{lobsters and crabs,}but during the{February to May}time{bigger {boats}move around{from Eday and {Stronsay}to catch fish for lobster bait in other areas. The main catch consists of{lobsters}ranging from about{1lb to 4.5lbs}and{crabs,}mainly Partans (Edible crabs) are measured by the stone.The price of lobsters and crabs depends on the time of year it is. From mid-winter to the beginning of{spring lobsters}can be as much as {Â£5.40 per pound,}but during the late {summer to early autumn}(the harvest) prices can be as low as{Â£1.75 per {pound. Crabs}usually go for around {Â£3.50 per stone}all through the year.
